news.title: Mairead McGuinness predicts ‘full on’ campaign as she gets nod to be Fine Gael’s presidential candidate
news.summary: Former EU Commissioner Mairead McGuinness has predicted the presidential campaign will be “full on” after being confirmed as the Fine Gael candidate.

news.title: Steven O’Meara: 16 years after he was shot and buried alive, the person who pulled the trigger has yet to face justice
news.summary: Almost 16 years after Steven O’Meara was lured to his death in the Wicklow Mountains and shot twice, before being buried alive, a woman has been arrested on suspicion of his murder.

news.title: Inquiry shown Snapchat messages from teacher who allegedly had sex with teen before her Leaving Cert
news.summary: A teacher who allegedly had sex with a teenager before her Leaving Cert told her years later that he had not had sex with other students.

news.title: Three Irish hotels named among Europe’s best in Travel + Leisure awards
news.summary: Three Irish hotels have been named among Europe's best in Travel + Leisure's World's Best Awards for 2025.

news.title: Woman (80s) awarded almost €60,000 in damages after falling on footpath
news.summary: An 80-year-old woman has been awarded just short of €60,000 damages by a judge who said her social life had been greatly impacted by injuries she suffered when she tripped and fell on a hazardous footpath.

news.title: Jury shown CCTV footage of pensioner Tom Niland at shop, two hours before alleged assault that led to death
news.summary: A jury has viewed CCTV footage showing 73-year-old Tom Niland walking into a shop near his house in Sligo about two hours before it is alleged three men broke into his home and assaulted him, leaving him with injuries that caused his death 20 months later.

news.title: Azealia Banks has had feuds with everyone from Aer Lingus to Beyoncé – but no one saw her spat with Conor McGregor coming
news.summary: Anyone with even a casual ear towards pop culture will know full well that Azealia Banks is not a woman to be tussled with.

news.title: Budget will focus on infrastructure not cost-of-living supports, Taoiseach says as he admits 30pc US tariffs would lead to job cuts
news.summary: PRICES are at "a relatively elevated level" the Taoiseach has admitted, after being attacked in the Dáil over the cost of living.

news.title: Home economics: ‘Should we apply for Fair Deal even if we think we’ll be refused?’
Lucinda O’Sullivan’s restaurant review: I’d love to say it was the gourmet experience promised but this Dublin city centre revamp fell short of the mark
news.summary: First impressions are lasting impressions, they say, which makes the role of the meeter/greeter in any restaurant, hotel, or cafe a vital one.
